task.title: Setting up a Floating License Server Running as a Standalone Process for Windows
task.shortdesc: Setting up the floating license server as a standalone process for Windows.

p.b: Steps for Installing the Floating License Server in Windows as a Standalone Process

step.cmd: Download the license server installation kit for Windows from the website.
Run the downloaded installer and follow the prompts.

info.p: By default, the installer installs the license server as a Windows service. You have the optional ability to start the Windows service automatically at Windows startup or create shortcuts on the Start menu for starting and stopping the Windows service manually. If you want to manually install, start, stop, or uninstall the server as a Windows service, run the following scripts from a command line as an Administrator:

ul.li: installWindowsService.bat [serviceName] - install the server as a Windows service with the name serviceName. The parameters for the license key folder and the server port can be set in the oXygenLicenseServer.vmoptions file.

info.note:
If you do not provide the serviceName argument, the default name oXygenLicenseServer is used.
When the license server is installed as a Windows service, the output and error messages are automatically redirected to the following log files that are created in the install folder:
outLicenseServer.log - standard output stream of the server
errLicenseServer.log - standard error stream of the server

step.cmd: Manually add oXygenLicenseServer.exe in the Windows Firewall list of exceptions. Go to Control Panel System and Security Windows Firewall Allow a program or feature through Windows Firewall Allow another program and browse for oXygenLicenseServer.exe from the oXygen License Server installation folder.
Make sure the license key directory contains a text file called license.txt that contains the license key corresponding to the set of purchased floating licenses.

info.note: If you have more than one floating license key for the same version, or you want to split a set of license keys between two different servers, please contact us at support@oxygenxml.com to merge or split your license keys.

taskbody.example:
Installing a License Server in Windows Using a Zip Archive Method
If for some reason you do not want to run the recommended executable installation file, you can also use a zip archive installation method in Windows. If you use the zip archive method in Windows, you have to run the scripts provided in the archive for installing, starting, stopping, and uninstalling the server as a Windows service.
If you do not want to set up the license server as a Windows service, you can manually start it by running the startup script licenseServer.bat. It has the following parameters:
licenseDir - The path of the directory where the license files will be placed. The default value is license.
port - The TCP port number used to communicate with instances. The default value is 12346. The following is an example of the command line for starting the license server on Windows:licenseServer.bat myLicenseDir 54321
